title: Creating a reading list on ethics in natural language processing (NLP) and best practices involves selecting articles that cover a range of topics, including bias, fairness, privacy, and the societal impact of NLP technologies. Here is a list of 20 articles and papers up to 2020 that you might find useful
**"Man is to Computer Programmer as Woman is to Homemaker? Debiasing Word Embeddings"** by Bolukbasi et al
- This paper discusses gender bias in word embeddings and proposes methods to reduce it
**"Word Embeddings Quantify 100 Years of Gender and Ethnic Stereotypes"** by Garg et al
- This article explores how word embeddings can reflect historical biases
**"Data Statements for Natural Language Processing: Toward Mitigating System Bias and Enabling Better Science"** by Bender and Friedman
- The authors propose a framework for documenting datasets to improve transparency and accountability
**"Gender Bias in Coreference Resolution: Evaluation and Debiasing Methods"** by Zhao et al
- This paper examines gender bias in coreference resolution systems and suggests debiasing techniques
**"Mitigating Unwanted Biases with Adversarial Learning"** by Zhang et al
- The authors present a method to reduce bias in NLP models using adversarial learning
**"All That’s ‘Human’ Is Not Gold: Evaluating Human Evaluation of Generated Text"** by Howcroft et al
- This paper critiques human evaluation methods in NLP and suggests improvements
**"On the Dangers of Stochastic Parrots: Can Language Models Be Too Big?"** by Bender et al
- Although published in 2021, this influential paper discusses the ethical implications of large language models
**"Fairness and Abstraction in Sociotechnical Systems"** by Selbst et al
- This article explores the challenges of ensuring fairness in complex systems, including NLP
**"The Role of Data in AI Ethics"** by Gebru et al
- The authors discuss the ethical considerations of data collection and usage in AI systems
**"Algorithmic Bias Detection and Mitigation: Best Practices and Policies to Reduce Consumer Harms"** by Mehrabi et al
- This paper provides an overview of bias in algorithms and suggests best practices for mitigation
**"Ethical Considerations in NLP Shared Tasks"** by Rogers et al
- The authors discuss ethical issues in organizing and participating in NLP shared tasks
**"Towards a Standard for Identifying and Managing Bias in Artificial Intelligence"** by Raji et al
- This article proposes a standard for identifying and managing bias in AI systems
**"Dissecting Racial Bias in an Online Abuse Corpus"** by Sap et al
- This paper analyzes racial bias in datasets used for training NLP models
**"Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning: Threat Models and Solutions"** by Shokri and Shmatikov
- The authors discuss privacy concerns in machine learning, relevant to NLP applications
**"The Ethics of AI Ethics: An Evaluation of Guidelines"** by Hagendorff
- This paper evaluates existing AI ethics guidelines and their applicability to NLP
**"Bias in Bios: A Case Study of Semantic Representation Bias in a High-Stakes Setting"** by De-Arteaga et al
- The authors examine bias in semantic representations in professional bios
- This survey provides a comprehensive overview of bias and fairness issues in machine learning, including NLP
**"The Moral Character of Cryptographic Work"** by Rogaway
- While focused on cryptography, this paper discusses broader ethical considerations relevant to all computational fields, including NLP
**"Algorithmic Accountability: A Primer"** by Diakopoulos
- This primer introduces the concept of algorithmic accountability, relevant to NLP systems
**"Ethics and Society Review: Ethics Reflection as a Precondition to Research Funding"** by Zook et al
- The authors propose integrating ethics reviews into the research funding process
These articles provide a broad overview of the ethical challenges and best practices in NLP, offering insights into how the field can address these issues
